text.0: i trust in thy first wrathful deed o indra when thou slewest vṛtra and didst work to profit man.
text.1: what time the two worldhalves fell short of thee in might and the earth trembled at thy force o thunderanned.
text.2: thou with thy magic powers didst rend the conjurer vṛtra o blameless one with heart that longed for fame.
text.3: heroes elect thee when they battle for the prey thee in all sacrifices worthy of renown.
text.4: god muchinvoked take pleasure in these princes here who thine exalters maghavan have come to wealth.
text.5: in synods when the rite succeeds they hymn the strong for sons and progeny and riches undisturbed.
text.6: that man shall find delight in wellprotected wealth whose care provides for him the quicksought joyous draught.
text.7: bringing oblations strengthened maghavan by thee he swiftly wins the spoil with heroes in the fight.
text.8: now for our band o maghavan when lauded make ample room with might and grant us riches.
text.9: magician thou our varuṇa and mitra deal food to us o wondrous as dispenser.
